newsitem.title: USA: Cummins sees Q1 EPS near $1.00.
newsitem.headline: Cummins sees Q1 EPS near $1.00.

text.p: Cummins Engine Co Inc said Tuesday it expected earnings for the first quarter to approach $1.00 a share. The company reported earnings per share of $1.21 a year ago.
Profit before tax in the first quarter is expected to be higher than in the fourth quarter of 1996 on somewhat lower sales, the company said.
The diesel engine maker reported sales of $1.4 billion in the fourth quarter and $1.3 billion in the first quarter of 1996.
Cummins chairman and chief executive officer Jim Henderson told shareholders that business conditions are favorable in most of its markets at this time, the company said in a news release.
"If business conditions continue as they are now, we expect higher earnings in the second quarter than the first," Henderson said.
The company's first quarter ended on March 31.
Cummins said gross savings from a restructuring undertaken in 1996 will grow to $80 million in 1998 from $50 million in 1996.
Cummins closed eight plants and five distribution centers, eliminated six businesses, and reduced employment by 2,300 people through the restructuring, the company said.
Cummins is also investing more than $1 billion in capital and product development from 1996 through 1999, the company said.
"By the year 2000, we will replace today's entire product line with the most advanced engines, product support and information technology in the world," Cummins president Tim Solso said.
Cummins shares were down 1-1/4 at 50 Tuesday before being halted for news dissemination.
